item.title: Trump Media stock hits 14-month low after DJT lockup lifts
item.description: Donald Trump is the majority owner of Trump Media, which owns social media platform Truth Social and trades as DJT on the Nasdaq.

item.title: Would-be Trump assassin Ryan Routh stalked ex-president for a month, prosecutors say
item.description: Ryan Routh left a witness a box containing a handwritten note that said, “This was an assassination attempt on Donald Trump but I failed you."

item.title: Success Of Humanity Lies Not In Battlefield: PM Modi At UN
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today called for reforms in the top global bodies, saying, "The success of humanity lies in our collective strength, not in the battlefield".

item.title: 274 Killed Including 21 Children In Israeli Strikes, Says Lebanon
item.description: Israeli air strikes on Hezbollah strongholds in Lebanon on Monday killed 182 people, according to the Lebanese health ministry, in by far the deadliest cross-border escalation since war erupted in Gaza on October 7.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Launches Intense Airstrikes on Hezbollah, Killing at Least 270 in Lebanon
item.description: It was the deadliest day of Israeli attacks in Lebanon since at least 2006. The armed group Hezbollah sent rockets into northern Israel and vowed to keep attacking.

item.title: Ukraine Needs to Be Realistic About Goals in War With Russia, Czech President Says
item.description: President Petr Pavel, a former NATO general who has been vocal in his support for Ukraine, said Kyiv needed to accept that some territory could remain under Russian control, at least “temporarily.”

item.title: Biden Meets With Emirati President in Washington
item.description: The meeting with Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed was expected to focus on Gaza, the war in Sudan and artificial intelligence. Vice President Kamala Harris is also scheduled to meet with the leader.

item.title: Live updates: Israel launches ‘extensive’ strikes on Hezbollah; Lebanon says hundreds killed, over 1,000 injured
item.description: Israel called for civilians in Lebanon to evacuate or move away from places it says could be storing weapons for Hezbollah.

item.title: What is Hezbollah’s political role in Lebanon and what is its relationship with Hamas?
'Let me...': TikTok creator slams Kamala Harris, says unauthorised clip in Oprah’s interview
item.description: TikTok creator Blaire Allison publicly criticized Oprah Winfrey's town hall with Kamala Harris for using her video without permission. Allison expressed discontent with Harris's presidential ambitions and clarified that Winfrey’s team did not secure her consent to use the clip. Her comments about financial struggles faced by average Americans gained significant traction on social media.

item.title: Reeves packs up her troubles until budget day and smiles, smiles, smiles | John Crace
item.description:
The chancellor beamed her way through a conference speech that offered hope at least but little of substance

  • Labour conference live – latest updates

Stop all the clocks, cut off the telephone. If you had thought that maybe today was the day when you made that call to Dignitas, then think again. Cancel that flight to Zurich. At least postpone it. Things might not be quite as bad as you had been led to believe. Or rather, they are that bad but there is some small flicker of hope if you can hold on long enough. There will be pain in the short and medium term. There’s no avoiding that. Try to think of it as character building. But possibly, just possibly, you might come through. We happy few. Blinking into the light of the promised land.

This was Rachel Reeves’s day. And she knew everything was going to be just fine the moment she woke up to find that Liz Truss had posted yet another cry for help on X. You can now follow the Trusster’s mental decline in real time on social media. It’s got so bad that she now films herself in front of a bookcase where everything is arranged by colour. The kindest explanation is that she thinks she’s filming a hostage video and the books are a coded message for “I’m being held against my will”.

Continue reading...

item.title: Lack of City of London oversight hurting efforts to halt dirty money, FCA warns
item.description:
Bodies responsible for monitoring accounting and legal sectors not doing enough to stop money laundering, watchdog says

A lack of proper oversight across the City of London’s network of lawyers, bookkeepers and accountants is hampering efforts to crack down on dirty money being funnelled through the UK, the City watchdog has warned.

The latest report by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) flagged concerns over the work of the UK’s 25 professional bodies – which oversee the accounting and legal sectors – and found that some were spending as little as £73 a year on anti-money laundering supervision or were outsourcing it entirely to third parties.

Continue reading...
